contents.item: In politics we presume that everyone who knows how to get votes knows how to administer a city or a state. When we are ill... we do not ask for the handsomest physician, or the most eloquent one.

I think us here to wonder, myself. To wonder. To ask. And that in wondering bout the big things and asking bout the big things, you learn about the little ones, almost by accident. But you never know nothing more about the big things than you start out with. The more I wonder, the more I love.
Only that day dawns to which we are awake. There is more day to dawn. The sun is but a morning star.
The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
Fair speech may hide a foul heart.
I consider it an extremely dangerous doctrine, because the more likely we are to assume that the solution comes from the outside, the less likely we are to solve our problems ourselves.

Words do not express thoughts very well; every thing immediately becomes a little different, a little distorted, a little foolish. And yet it also pleases me and seems right that what is of value and wisdom of one man seems nonsense to another.
Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.
When you realize there is something you don't understand, then you're generally on the right path to understanding all kinds of things.
It is therefore senseless to think of complaining since nothing foreign has decided what we feel, what we live, or what we are.
Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
contents.owner: Kahlil Gibran, Mirrors of the Soul

contents.item: Challenges are gifts that force us to search for a new center of gravity. Don't fight them. Just find a new way to stand.
One must wait until the evening to see how splendid the day has been.
If anyone on the verge of action should judge himself according to the outcome, he would never begin.
Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.
I do not know how to teach philosophy without becoming a disturber of the peace.
Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future too.
To make light of philosophy is to be a true philosopher.
Choose to be happy. It is what we have all done.
